text:
The "jar" ant tasks uses the org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Manifest which restricts the 
length of a entry in the MANIFEST.INF to MAX_LINE_LENGTH (70). This restriction means that 
classpath entries are truncated.

Please could you advise if 70 is a restriction of jar files 
or just a bug in the org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Manifest source ?

Thanks,
Joe
creator: joe.pullen@espalier.com

text:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/guide/jar/jar.html

Line length: 
No line may be longer than 72 bytes (not characters), in its UTF8-encoded form. 
If a value would make the initial line longer than this, it should be continued 
on extra lines (each starting with a single SPACE). 

---
I believe 70 should be replaced by 72 (I think it originally wanted to exclude 
the ': ') and getBytes() by getBytes("UTF8")
creator: sbailliez@apache.org

text:
Note:

70 is the MAX_HEADER_LENGTH

"
Limitations: 
Because header names cannot be continued, the maximum length of a header name 
is 70 bytes (there must be a colon and a SPACE after the name). 
[...]
"
creator: sbailliez@apache.org
conor@apache.org
text:
Classpath entries are not truncated - they are continued on the next line using 
a "continuation" line.
